revised_title: Influence of Mosaic Sex-Pheromones on Male Courtship Behavior in Drosophila melanogaster
tldr: The authors created stable strains of Drosophila melanogaster with mosaic sex-pheromones by manipulating the sex-determination gene transformer. They found that the male courtship behavior was influenced by the combination of stimulatory and inhibitory pheromones produced by live sex-mosaic flies. The study highlights the role of these substances in their structure, sexual specificity, and evolutionary function.
